episode_title: 609 - The One Where Ross Got High

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica is mixing some Thanksgiving treat (I’m assuming mashed potatoes) in a bowl.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, great! Bye. (Hangs up as Chandler enters.) So guess who’s coming to Thanksgiving dinner?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sydney Portier? Hehheh.
[Chandler throws his coat on the couch]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I miss Rachel. (To Chandler) No, my parents.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh! That’s great, they haven’t seen the place since I moved in!
[Monica goes to fiddle with something on the table.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, and y’know, if you could not mention to them that we live together, that would be great! (Quickly trying to change subjects), I was thinking we would eat around four.
[Monica goes to the stove.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why can’t I tell them that we live together?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Because they don’t know we’re dating. (Again, trying to quickly change subjects.) Do you think we should eat in the kitchen? (Goes to the sink and the stove to cook.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why haven’t you told them?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Um, well, I was going to, I-I-I really was. But um, then somewhere, just out of nowhere, I didn’t.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why haven’t you told them?! Wouldn’t they be happy?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So! Dinner in the kitchen around four! I’ll see you then. (Pats Chandler on the shoulder and goes into the living room.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why wouldn’t they be happy?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, um, because mainly, um, they don’t like you. I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What? What? Why?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Maybe because you used to be aloof, or that you’re really sarcastic, or that, y’know, you joke around all the time. Or that you take off your clothes and throw them on the couch.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Is this why they don’t like me or why you don’t like me?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look, I know that I should’ve told them. I know I shouldn’t care what they think. I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, it’ll be okay. It’ll be okay. Because when they come over, I will be all charming, I will make them fall in love with me, and then we’ll tell ‘em.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You really think that’ll work?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, I can be pretty charming, babe, I won YOU over, didn’t I?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t think you’ll ever get my parents that drunk!

content.description: [Scene: Joey and Janine’s, Joey and Ross are playing Sony Playstation. Chandler enters.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey! (Sees Ross is there) Oh, good, Ross! You’re parents like me, right?
[Chandler goes to stand to the side of the TV.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, of course they like you!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well Monica just told me that they don’t.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, they don’t like you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Do you know why?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I dunno, maybe it’s because you’re really sarcastic. Or maybe it’s cause you uh-

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well if people don’t know they shouldn’t just guess!
[Joey and Ross get annoyed with Chandler’s outburst.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This is great, another Thanksgiving with nothing to give thanks for.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Maybe I could give thanks for you shuttin’ up, eh?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Maybe I could give thanks by taking my Playstation over to my new apartment.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well maybe I love ya’.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [mocks that last comment].
[Chandler starts to leave as Janine enters]
Janine [to Chandler]: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.
[Chandler exits]

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Hey guys!
[Joey and Ross drop their video game controllers.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No I don’t want to play video games, Joey!
content.parenthetical: trying to act manly in front of Janine

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Are you guys going to Chandler’s for Thanksgiving?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! Yeah, why? What’s up?

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Well, me and my dancer friends are thinking of doing Thanksgiving uptown. I thought you guys might like to come.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: For real?

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: No, but you should go to Chandler’s. Because none of us knows how to cook, we’ll probably just end up drinking all day.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ye-ye, we go to yours!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, see, we-we-we have to stop across the hall, because it’s my sister. But, uh, uh y’know actually, growing up with a sister was nice because it really helped me understand women. Yeah, you-you should tell your friends that.

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Okay.
content.parenthetical: not sure of what to make of that

content.text: [Janine leaves]
[Ross looks at Joey coyly.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How you got three women to marry you, I’ll never know.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Phoebe enters with a paper turkey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! Hey, Pheebs, check it out. Yeah, for my desert, I have chosen to make a traditional English truffle!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow, that sounds great! And what are you making Monica, in case Rachel’s dessert is…[about to say “bad”] so good that I eat all of it. There’s none left for anybody else!
[Monica, Phoebe, and Rachel laugh]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nothing.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Nothing?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, sweetie, I-I trust you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So, if-if I mess this up, there’s nothing else for dessert?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re not gonna mess it up.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow, Monica, I love that, you really have faith in me. Thank you. Technical question, how do you know when uh, the butter’s done?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, it’s done about two minutes before it looks like that.
[Joey and Ross enter.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, ooh the food smells great, Mon!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And the place looks so nice!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, hey hey, Happy Thanksgiving everybody!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Happy Thanksgiving!

content.speaker: The Girls
content.text: Happy Thanksgiving!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, this has been great!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: See ya!
[Joey and Ross go to the door, ready to leave.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Whoa whoa whoa! Where’re you goin’?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, oh, we did say we’d stop by this little thing Joey’s roommate is having.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, Janine, the really hot dancer girl?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Some would say she’s attractive, yes.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And who else is going to be there?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, some of her friends, yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Her dancer friends?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes, all right? All of her hot dancer friends are gonna be there and they’re gonna be, be drinkin’ and dancin, and we really wanna go!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Dude, we were good!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re not gonna go anywhere, you said you were gonna eat here, and you’re gonna eat here!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, and-and leaving us to go see hot dancer girls is not very Thanksgivingy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, but-but it is, uh, it’s just like the first Thanksgiving, when the Indians and the Pilgrims uh, sat down to dinner.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, yeah, and the Indians taught the Pilgrims what it meant to be hot in the new world!
[Enter Jack and Judy Geller]

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Hello everybody!

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hi!
[Kisses and hugs are exchanged.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Dad [kisses Jack], Mom [kisses Judy]. Look! Look who it is it’s Chandler!

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Oh yes of course, hello Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Mr. and Mrs. Geller, you look wonderful, it is great to have you hear, let us take off your coats!
[Chandler goes to take off Jack’s coat. He then notices little white flakes on Jack’s shoulders. He begins to wipe them off.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Whoa, snowing out there?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: No.

[Time lapse. The gang is sitting down for Thanksgiving dinner. Chandler is at the head of the table, Mr and Mrs Geller are to his right. Joey and Ross are to his left. Monica is serving things. Phoebe is in the living room and Rachel is at the sink.]

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Monica, all this food looks wonderful, you should think about doing this for a living.
[Chandler, trying to make nice with Jack, laughs at his joke and points at Jack.]

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Ok, I have dandruff. There’s no need to laugh and point.
[Monica rushes over to Chandler’s side.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Dad, Chandler was just laughing at your joke.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: My joke wasn’t funny.
[Phoebe walks from the living room to the kitchen and talks quietly to Rachel.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Rach, Rach, I just remembered. I had a dream about Mr. Geller last night.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I dreamt that he saved me from a burning building and he was so brave and so strong! And it’s making me look at him totally differently. Y’know, I mean he used to be just, y’know “Jack Geller Monica and Ross’s dad” and now he’s he’s “Jack Geller, dream hunk.”
[We see a shot of Jack stuffing his face with food. Some dream hunk!]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I dunno. Y’know to me he’ll always be “Jack Geller, walks in while you’re changing.”
[Time lapse. Ross and Joey are cleaning the table while Judy and Phoebe talk by the window. Jack and Chandler are sitting on the couch while Monica sits on the coffee table.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know dad, Chandler is one of Ross’s very best friends!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, Ross sure is a great guy, y’know I’ve always felt that how a young man turns out is a reflection on his father.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: I always thought that too. Tell me, what does your father do?
[Chandler and Monica exchange worried looks.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: He’s the headliner of a gay burlesque show.
[Rachel is in the kitchen fiddling with her English truffle. Joey and Ross, anxious to leave and go to Janine’s party, are egging her on to hurry up.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Rach, you’re killin’ us here, will ya serve the dessert already? Those drunken dancers are waiting!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Look at it, isn’t it beautiful?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, yeah, what is it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s a truffle. It’s got all of these layers. First there’s a layer of ladyfingers, then a layer of jam, then custard, which I made from scratch, [Joey and Ross make impressed faces] then raspberries, more ladyfingers, then beef sauteed with peas and onions, [Joey and Ross look like something’s wrong.] then a little more custard, and then bananas, and then I just put some whipped cream on top!
[Joey and Ross make confused faces.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: W-What was the one right before bananas?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: The beef? Yeah, that was weird to me, too. But then, y’know, I thought “well, there’s mincemeat pie,” I mean that’s an English dessert, these people just put very strange things in their food, y’know. [To Joey] Oh! by the way, can I borrow some Rum from your place?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Y-sure!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And while I’m gone don’t you boys sneak a taste.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay.
[Rachel leaves]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Beef in a dessert?! I- no no no, there is no way!
[Ross goes to look in the magazine Rachel got her recipe from.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know, and only one layer of jam?! What is up with that?
[Ross looks up as if saying that Joey was weird. He begins flipping through the pages, only to find that they are sticky. So one page is overlapping another, making two recipes look like one.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my God, the pages are stuck together!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Chandler!
content.parenthetical: turning to Chandler in a scolding tone

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh My God, she-she made half a English Trifle, and half a…Sheperd’s Pie!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh man! Now she’s gonna start all over! We’re never gonna get to introduce the hot girls to the new world!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, we will. We just won’t tell her she messed up.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Just let her serve the beef-custard thing?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, it’ll be like a funny Thanksgiving story!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Vomiting stories are funny…
content.parenthetical: shrugging his shoulders to go along with it

content.text: [Rachel enters]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, God, your apartment is like a hundred degrees!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Did-did it make you wanna walk around in your underwear?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Still not hot enough!
[Joey leaves]
[Phoebe walks over to talk to Rachel.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Rachel?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, look at him. Look at those strong hands. Oh what I wouldn’t give to be that can of (looks closer to see what Jack is drinking) condensed milk.
[We see a shot of Jack drinking condensed milk on the couch.]
[Ross and Judy enter the living room. Judy and Ross sit down on the couch beside Jack. Monica and Chandler are sitting on the coffee table.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Mom, uh, Chandler was just saying how beautiful your sweater is.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Oh, thank you Chandler! I just bought it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, yes. Well it’s very beautiful. It’s cream-colored and tight [Realizes what he just said and looks worried. Monica and Ross also looked shocked. Judy and Jack give Chandler a very dirty look.] I don’t mean tight, I mean it’s not too tight, not that I was looking at-[giving up all hope, he puts his head into his hands.]

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: What’s the matter with him?

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: I think he’s stoned again.
content.parenthetical: whispers to Jack a little loudly

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Dude, I need to talk to you a sec.
[Ross and Chandler get up and go into Rachel’s old room.]

content.description: Rachel’s old room. It’s pretty much empty except for a few boxes against the walls. Ross and Chandler enter.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, I think I might know why my parents don’t like you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You do? Why?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, remember, we were young. Hey, Spring break, sophomore year, I got high in my bedroom and my parents walked in and smelled it and so I told them that you had gotten stoned and jumped out the window.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?! Why did you do that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know, aheh, your’s was the first name that-that popped into my head, I’m I’m sorry. I-I didn’t think it would matter.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How could it not matter?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How was I supposed to know we’d end up being friends after college, let alone you-you would be living with my sister?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What about all that “friends forever” stuff?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know, I-I was all high.

content.description: Rachel’s Old Bedroom, Continued from earlier. Monica enters the room.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Mom and dad just sent me in here to find out if you (points to Chandler) were trying to get Ross stoned!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Your parents caught Ross smoking pot in college and he blamed it on me!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross, I can’t believe you’d do that!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The reason we haven’t told them we’re together is because they hate me, okay? So will you fix this?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, okay, I’ll tell ‘em it wasn’t Chandler who got high. Now who should I say it was?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You! It’s not like it’s a big deal! You-you don’t still do it or anything!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Alright, alright, now-now who should I say tricked me into doing it?

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Time lapse. Jack is still on the couch, picking his teeth with his feet on the table. Phoebe and Judy are sitting on the table looking at him. Ross and Chandler are sitting by the window talking. Rachel and Joey are in the kitchen fooling with Rachel’s trifle. Monica walks into the living room from the kitchen.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Dad, please don’t pick your teeth out here! Alright, and if you’re gonna put your feet up, why don’t you sit on the-

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Monica, leave him alone !
[Monica gives Phoebe a surprised expression and goes over to Ross and Chandler.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Will you hurry up? Did you not hear me before when I told you that all of Janine’s friends are dancers?! And that they’re going to be drinking alot!?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, I did, but tell me again, because it’s so romantic.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well you’re whippin’ so slow! Can’t you do it any faster?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey! Come on! I don’t wanna make any mistakes, alright? This is the only dessert and if I screw it up everybody’s gonna be like “Oh, remember that Thanksgiving when Rachel screwed up the trifle?”
[Joey gives her an understanding look.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So why don’t you just let me worry about making the trifle and you just worry about eating it, alright?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh I am!
[Chandler and Monica are by the window pressuring Ross to tell his parents the truth.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross, if you don’t tell them, then I will!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, fine!
[Ross gets up to go tell his parents.]
[Joey rushes over.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ross! Can I talk to you for a second?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, uh, can it wait a second Joey? I have to tell my parents something. No it can’t? Okay.
[Monica and Chandler make “What was that?” gestures. Joey and Ross go into Rachel’s old room.]

content.description: Rachel’s old room, Ross and Joey enter.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, look, I think we have to tell Rachel she messed up her dessert.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?! What is with everybody? It’s Thanksgiving, not…Truth-Day!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, when everyone eats that…that…Banana-Meat thing, they’re all gonna’ make fun of her, do you want that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, okay, we’ll just get everyone to act like they like it. That-that way noone makes fun of her and we still get to go to Sweet Potatoe Pie! (Referring to the dancers.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dude, they’re not objects.
[Ross makes a sorry face.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Just kiddin,’ I’ll talk to them, you distract Rach.
[Joey and Ross go back out into the main area.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey Rach, can I talk to you outside for a second?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay…
[The hallway. Rachel and Ross go out and they just stand there for a few seconds.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’s up, Ross?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So um…Thanksgiving. The holiday season is upon us, hm?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And um…You look nice today.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no. No Ross, don’t do this.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I just- I don’t think us getting back together is a good idea.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Eh?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I thought this might happen today. Ross, I know the holidays can be rough. Y’know? And it’s probably really hard for you to be alone right now.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re alone.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, I-I live with Phoebe. I mean you’re [pity-tone] alone , alone. And I just-it’s just not the time for us. I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ah well, can’t blame a guy for trying!
content.parenthetical: just trying to get out of the conversation

content.text: [Inside Monica and Chandler’s. Joey is almost done explaining the situation to everyone.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh and (Ross begins to open the door and Joey says some gibberish word to indicate to Ross that he’s not done yet. Ross closes the door again.) Okay, and uh if anyone needs help pretending to like it, I learned something in acting class, try uh, rubbing your stomach (Rubs his stomach) or uh, or saying “mmm” and uh, oh oh! And smiling (Smiles while pretending to stir a bowl), okay?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I’m not gonna pay for those acting classes anymore.
[Ross and Rachel re-enter.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Rachel, there you are! Come on, let’s serve that dessert already!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, you’re gonna have to stop rushing me, you know what? You don’t get any dessert.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, I’m just kidding I would never do that to you! Okay, everybody, it’s trifle time!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So, now, Rach, this is a traditional English trifle, isn’t it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It sure is.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow. So then did you make it with beef or Eggplant?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Beef.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can’t have any. You know I don’t eat meat. (Faking dissapointment.) Ohhh no.
[Phoebe gets up and goes into Rachel’s old room, a smile on her face.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Alright, Monica, I want you to have the first taste.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?
[Rachel hands Monica a plate. Monica takes a spoonful of the whipped cream portion.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh oh oh, wait! You only got whipped cream in there! Ya gotta take a bite with all the layers!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.
[Monica takes a bigger spoonful and a pea falls off]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Op! Wait, you dropped a pea.
[Monica puts the pea on top of the spoonful and takes a bite.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Mmmm! It’s good!
content.parenthetical: faking joy. Rubbing her stomach and smiling at the same time, like Joey said

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really? How good?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s so good, that I feel really selfish about being the only one who’s eating it, that I think we should have everyone taste how good it is. Especially Ross.
[Ross glares at Monica.]
[Everyone takes a bite of their trifle.]

content.speaker: All
content.text: Mmm.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, this is so good, that I’m gonna go enjoy it on the balcony so that I can enjoy the view whilst I enjoy my dessert.
content.parenthetical: clearly lying and hating the dessert

content.text: [Chandler exits to the balcony.]

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: I’ve gotta call my friend Mary and tell her how good this is, from Monica’s room.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: I’ll help you dial.
[Jack and Judy exit to Monica’s room.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m gonna go into the bathroom so I can look at it in the mirror, as I eat it.
[Monica exits to the bathroom.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, now what was that all about? Is it-does it not taste good? Let me try it.
[Rachel reaches for Ross’s plate]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wha? No no! Ah! (Ross scarfs all of his trifle down in about a second. He looks like he’s going to throw up.) (Lying) All gone! So good! Maybe Chandler has some left.
[Rachel leaves to the balcony.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It tastes like feet!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I like it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Are you kidding?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’s not to like? Custard? Good. Jam? Good. Meat? Gooooood.
[Rachel and Chandler re-emerge from the balcony.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: …So a bird just grabbed it, and then tried to fly away with it and, and then just dropped it on the street?
[Chandler makes a fake “I know I couldn’t believe it either” gesture.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, but if it’s any consolation, before the bird dropped it, he seemed to enjoy it.
[Phoebe comes back from Rachel’s old room.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Rachel, come here. (Rachel walks over to Phoebe. Chandler sits down on the lounge-chair.) Okay, I was just starting to take my Thanksgiving nap, and I had another dream about Jack.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, Phoebe, do I wanna hear this?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I dunno, let’s see! So, okay, I dreamt that we were gonna get married, and he left, becuz he had to go fight a fire. And, um, so okay, I went to a night club, and I saw him making out with a girl.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God, he dream-cheated on you!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, but then Jacques Cousteau came and he kicked his ass for betraying me! It was soo cool! Then, he took me diving and he introduced me to his pet seahorse, who, by the way, was totally coming on to me, and please, that is not gonna happen.
[Jack and Judy come out of Monica’s room and sit down on the couch.]

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Boy, I’m glad I wore the big belt today.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Five minutes ago, a line like that would’ve floored me. Now nothing. Well, not nothing, I am still a woman.
[Rachel and Phoebe walk into the kitchen. Monica comes out of the bathroom and goes over to Ross.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross? Let’s go.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh yeah, about telling Mom and Dad, I was thinking about maybe writing a letter.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Alright, you know what? That’s it. You’ve had your chance.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wha-what?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Mom! Dad! Ross smoked pot in college!

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: (To Monica) You are such a tattletale! Mom, Dad, you remember that-that time you walked in my room and smelled marijuana?

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Yes. (They look at Chandler angrily.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well I told you it was Chandler who was smoking the pot but it was me. I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: It was you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And Dad, y’know that mailman that you got fired? He didn’t steal your Playboys! Ross did!
[The Gellers stare at Ross. Ross looks at his parents with an afraid, shocked look.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, well, Hurricane Gloria didn’t break the porch swing, Monica did!
[The Gellers glare at Monica.]
[Joey, Phoebe, and Rachel are sitting at the table, looking at the Geller siblings like they’re weirdos.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross hasn’t worked at the museum for a year!
[The Gellers glare at Ross.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Monica and Chandler are living together!
[The Gellers glare at Monica, shocked]
[Monica and Chandler both are shocked. Ross gives Monica a “take that!” look.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross married Rachel in Vegas! And got divorced! Again!!!!
[The Gellers glare at Ross.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I love Jacques Cousteau!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I wasn’t supposed to put beef in the trifle!
content.parenthetical: reading the recipe magazine, finally figuring out that…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I wanna gooooooo!

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: That’s alot of information to get in in thirty seconds! Alright Joey, if wanna leave, just leave. Rachel, no you weren’t supposed to put beef in the trifle. It did not taste good. Phoebe, I’m sorry, but I think Jacques Cousteau is dead. (Phoebe makes a sad face.) Monica, why you felt you had to hide the fact that you were in an important relationship is beyond me.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: And we kinda figured about the porch swing.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Ross, drugs? Divorced? Again?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: What happened son?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I-I uh, I got tricked into all those things!

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Chandler! You’ve been Ross’s best friend all these years, stuck by him during the drug problems. (Ross gets disgusted.) And now you’ve taken on Monica as well. Well, I don’t know what to say. You’re a wonderful human being.
[Chandler is mega shocked!]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thank you!

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: No! Thank you! (Hugs Chandler) Monica, and Ross! I don’t know what I’m gonna do about the two of you!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’ll talk to them!

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Everyone is helping clean the table.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You guys! It was bananas, cream, and beef! I-I just cannot believe that you ate that so that I wouldn’t feel bad!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well actually, I-I didn’t eat mine. It’s still in the bathroom.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No it isn’t, I ate that.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Well we left ours in Monica’s bedroom.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nope, got it and I got yours (Pointing to Jack) too.
